decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with powerful abilities to quickly apply pressure and overwhelm the opponent. By combining aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer with support cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison, it aims to control the battlefield and deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes various ways to generate tokens and maximize board presence, such as Ocelot Pride and Seasoned Pyromancer. Additionally, it provides disruption with cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Thraben Charm, while also ensuring mana consistency with a mix of lands and ramp spells.

The deck focuses on quickly disrupting the opponent's game plan by using a combination of low-cost creatures and removal spells. It utilizes efficient creatures like Flickerwisp and Recruiter of the Guard to control the board while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Aven Interrupter and Overlord of the Balemurk. Aether Vial allows for fast creature deployment, while Ephemerate provides additional value by blinking creatures with powerful enters-the-battlefield effects. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while slowly building up its own board presence to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard recursion and card advantage to set up a combo win condition utilizing Underworld Breach and Grinding Station. Emry, Lurker of the Loch, and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and help with setting up the combo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps find key pieces while Lavinia, Azorius Renegade disrupts the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Portable Hole and Soul-Guide Lantern to control the opponent's board state. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game quickly through mill or damage.

The deck focuses on assembling the necessary pieces to create powerful combos and generate big mana. Cards like Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor are crucial to ramping up fast and efficiently. Utilizing land tutors like Expedition Map and Tolaria West, along with strong lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, the deck aims for explosive plays and game-winning sequences. By utilizing various land synergies and combo pieces, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and establish a dominant board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to create a powerful combo that allows you to continually loop cards from your graveyard and your library to eventually win the game. Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and other cards help you dig through your deck and set up the combo. Other cards like Malevolent Rumble provide additional support and disruption to control the game. The goal is to efficiently assemble the combo pieces and outvalue your opponent to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on generating value through the Cascade mechanic, using cards like Shardless Agent and Ardent Plea to cheat out high-cost spells like Crashing Footfalls and Scion of Draco. With Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to support the archetype, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive playstyle. It also includes interaction with cards like Force of Negation and Mystical Dispute to control the board. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the multicolored spells in the deck. Overall, the strategy revolves around casting powerful spells for free and maximizing efficiency.

This deck focuses on utilizing a landless combo strategy to quickly generate mana and disrupt opponent's plays. It combines cards like Thundertrap Trainer, Hydroelectric Specimen, and Tameshi, Reality Architect to ramp up mana production, while using Lotus Bloom and Goblin Charbelcher for win conditions. Control elements like Force of Negation, Disrupting Shoal, and Spell Snare help protect the combo pieces, while cards like Jwari Disruption, Sink into Stupor, and Suppression Ray disrupt opponent's game plan. Whir of Invention and Sea Gate Restoration provide additional utility and card advantage to keep the deck running smoothly.

The deck focuses on using ramp and control elements to quickly accelerate Eldrazi threats onto the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells and disruptive artifacts. It aims to control the game early on with cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Return, then quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to overwhelm the opponent. The deck's mana base is focused on providing the necessary colorless mana sources to ramp into its Eldrazi threats efficiently.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to use Underworld Breach in conjunction with Grinding Station and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to mill the opponent's library and win the game. It utilizes various artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and card advantage, while also including interaction like Unholy Heat and Engineered Explosives to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The powerful synergies between these cards allow the deck to efficiently execute its game plan and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on maintaining control over the opponent through a combination of countering spells, destroying threats, and disrupting their resources. By using a mix of countermagic, removal spells, and hand disruption, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while deploying its own threats, such as Murktide Regent and Grist, the Hunger Tide. The deck also utilizes graveyard recursion with Unearth and Thought Scour to further outvalue the opponent. Through efficient removal and disruption, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory.

The deck focuses on using various creatures and spells to disrupt and control the opponent's board while dealing damage quickly. It utilizes cards like Fatal Push and Solitude for removal, Aether Vial for mana acceleration, and Ephemerate for extra value. It also includes creatures with powerful abilities like Skyclave Apparition and Recruiter of the Guard to control the board and create advantage. The key strategy is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and maintain control throughout the game.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's plans with a variety of counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage through card draw and graveyard recursion. The deck aims to control the game by countering key spells, removing threats, and eventually winning through its powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's strategy, the deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents in a slower, more controlling game plan.

This deck focuses on rapidly ramping up mana to play powerful Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule, while utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Cards like Through the Breach and Yggdrasil, Rebirth Engine allow for fast deployment of Eldrazi threats, backed up by counterspells like Kozilek's Command and card draw with Nulldrifter. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures like Ulamog, the Defiler and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, while maintaining control of the game through disruptive spells and efficient mana sources.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo utilizing Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect to generate massive amounts of mana, allowing for explosive plays with cards like Goblin Charbelcher. It also includes control elements like Force of Negation and Suppression Ray to protect the combo pieces. The deck utilizes Whir of Invention to tutor for key cards and has access to card draw and filtering with Preordain and Waterlogged Teachings. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful win condition.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and mana producers like Ruby Medallion, in order to cast a high number of spells in a single turn. This allows the player to utilize cards like Past in Flames to recast spells from the graveyard and generate additional value. Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible provide card draw and digging for combo pieces, while Wish can tutor for specific cards needed for the win condition. The deck aims to combo off and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures that can be searched for and deployed to create powerful interactions and combos. It utilizes toolbox cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to find specific creatures needed for the situation. The deck also includes cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide to generate value and control the board. Overall, the deck aims to create a flexible and dynamic game plan through the use of versatile creatures and combo potential.
